meanings.definition: To make impure by contact or mixture
meanings.sent1: The dirty water contaminated the clean stream.
meanings.sent2: The spilled oil contaminated the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon contaminated the picnic by knocking over the trash can.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude contaminated the team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The virus quickly contaminated the entire population.

meanings.definition: To expose to infection or disease
meanings.sent1: The sick person contaminated the others in the room.
meanings.sent2: The moldy food contaminated the entire batch.
meanings.sent3: The sneezing clown contaminated the party with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter contaminated the serious meeting.
meanings.sent5: The virus easily contaminated the entire school.

meanings.definition: To make unfit for use by the introduction of unwholesome or undesirable elements
meanings.sent1: The expired milk contaminated the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The broken glass contaminated the salad.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef contaminated the dish with too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The loud music contaminated the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments contaminated the positive vibes.
